intro: Bromheadia finlaysoniana, commonly known as the Malayan arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy rhizomes that store nutrients. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences with white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
